title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1225.27 - Shippers, consignees and connecting carriers to use berth space designated by superintendent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1225.27 - Shippers, consignees and connecting carriers to use berth space designated by superintendent

State Regulations
(a) Shippers, consignees and connecting carriers (other than carriers licensed to
use berth space at the terminal) handling freight routed by way of a carrier so
licensed, shall use only such berth space as may from time to time be
designated for their use by the superintendent. (b) The use of such berth space shall be
permitted only during the time a vehicle is actually being loaded or unloaded
and the superintendent may order any vehicle removed or cause same to be
removed from the terminal or to another location therein, when it is not
actually loading or unloading. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
